g.text: commands in parallel on multiple repositories.
command on multiple repositories in parallel.
runs a flat search in the current
command will then be ran on every repository found (unless excluded via
-e/--exclude flag or app configuration) along with any flags and arguments that were
Outputs from each repository will then be displayed in a pretty formatted graph tree.
flag may be passed to display the outputs in a pager.
path can be used to change the root path from which git
repositories will be searched to invoke the command.
flag can be passed one or more times along with a
glob/relative/absolute path to exclude repositories from the run.
on all repositories in the current directory
# could also be written with the flag `--root .`
on all repos in the parent directory
on all repos in current directory, excluding 'foo' and 'bar', and any
repo in parent directory who's name contains 'bazz'
on all repos in current directory, but exclude the current directory
itself if it is a git repo and any repo who's name contains 'bazz'
of all repos in the current directory and display output in a
on all repos in the current directory, only show the stat and ignore
